title: Assaulted police officers asked to waive compensation pay-outs from their violent attackers
text:
Police officers assaulted by violent criminals are being asked by the courts to waive compensation pay-outs because the offenders are jobless or in jail.

The officers complain that they are being denied justice by the failure of courts to pursue offenders for compensation.

They say the pay-outs act as a deterrent to stop criminals thinking they can get away with assault, remind them of the offence and curtail their spending on alcohol and drugs that fuel their crime.

PC Dan Halliwell who suffered a back injury after arresting a violent offender has twice been asked to waive the compensation originally ordered by the court almost three years ago, the second time because the criminal had been jailed...
description: Police officers assaulted by violent criminals are being asked by the courts to waive compensation pay-outs because the offenders are jobless or in jail.
